name: Dioptra
headline: Automated contract review with AI
description: We help founders and in-house counsels streamline their contract negotiations to close deals faster. We do this by building your contract negotiation playbooks and automating them with AI.

founders.name: Pierre Arnoux, Founder
founders.description: Pierre has 8+ years of hands-on experience both at IBM Watson and smaller startups. He trained and deployed the first pre-trained  IBM Watson service (personality insights). Pierre worked on different types of models (NLP, Computer Vision, Automated Speech Recognition). He taught a master’s degree class on MLOps at Columbia University. Pierre has a MS in Electrical Engineering from Columbia University.

founders.name: Jacques Arnoux, Founder
founders.description: Jacques is a systems and software engineer with 10+ years of experience in web-scale consumer and enterprise software. He’s an ex-Yahoo and was employee number 8 and lead engineer at Netsil, an application monitoring start-up that was acquired by Nutanix. He built Nutanix’s AiOps business and cloud data-pipeline. Jacques has a Masters degree in Computer Science from the University of Pennsylvania.

generated_description:
**Dioptra: Revolutionizing Contract Review with AI**

Founded in 2021 and backed by Y Combinator’s W22 batch, Dioptra is based in New York and aims to transform the way businesses handle contract negotiations. With a mission to automate contract review processes using AI, Dioptra helps founders and in-house counsel close deals faster by streamlining negotiations and providing customizable playbooks.

### What They Do

Dioptra leverages AI to facilitate contract review, allowing users to generate accurate redlines directly in Microsoft Word. The platform is designed to derive playbooks from existing agreements, ensuring that reviews are consistent and aligned with organizational guidelines. 

A standout feature is their new tool, PromptIQ, designed to offer accurate AI assistance at your fingertips. This tool, combined with Dioptra's ability to integrate seamlessly with document repositories, makes contract management more efficient and less labor-intensive.

### Features That Stand Out

- **Playbooks & Customization**: Whether you have a playbook or need to create one, Dioptra can accommodate both, enhancing your review process.
- **Word Add-in**: Users can work comfortably within familiar environments, integrating their operations directly into Microsoft Word.
- **Accuracy Metrics**: Dioptra boasts impressive accuracy rates—95% for first-party documents, 92% for third-party papers, and 94% for issue detection.

### Why It Matters

Contract review is traditionally seen as a tedious and time-consuming task. Dioptra’s AI-powered solution significantly reduces the time it takes to analyze contracts, turning hours of work into mere minutes. As one user noted, a review that usually took 45 minutes of “painful intellectual labor” was completed in just 10 minutes with Dioptra. 

This efficiency is underpinned by Dioptra’s commitment to security, being SOC 2 Type II compliant and ensuring strong data protection practices.

### Who’s Using Dioptra?

Dioptra counts an array of clients among its supporters, from boutique law firms to big tech companies. Testimonials highlight its effectiveness in producing high-quality redlines and providing valuable insights during the review process.

### Conclusion

If you're involved in contract negotiations and looking for a quicker, more reliable way to ensure accuracy and compliance, it's worth exploring what Dioptra has to offer. With a robust combination of AI-driven technology and user-focused features, Dioptra stands as a significant player in the legal tech space.

For more information, check out [Dioptra’s website](https://dioptra.ai/).
